subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] MiniBox - General Recommendations
author: Frank Sumption

I think you need a box. 
 Frank-S


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: ckmor=
ris95@...: Mon, 3 Dec 2007 10:34:18 -0600Subject: RE: [EVP-IT=
C] MiniBox - General Recommendations






I have never had a box and I am =
trying to get enough money to by the RS handheld (hopefully soon from Santa=
 J)  Anyway, I used to have conversations with several different toys.  At =
first they would keep me all night going off and I finally started to ask t=
hem questions.  I never felt scared even when they responded with the exact=
 number of noises in a row to questions =96 mainly yes or no =96 because of=
 course they couldn=92t talk.  I think the weirdest time was when a toy and=
 I had a conversation only to learn that there weren=92t any batteries in t=
he darn thing.  When I did start to get a bit creeped out I=92d tell them s=
o and the conversation would end.
They never did anything to harm me or my =
children =96 except maybe throw the lights on in the entire house at one ti=
me in the middle of the night.  More like pranksters=85 
I moved away from =
that house 4 years ago and my last memory was telling the toys to be quiet =
so I could sleep and they did.  I miss that house.  
k 
 




From: EVP-ITC=
@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Frank Sumpti=
onSent: Monday, December 03, 2007 9:48 AMTo: evp-itc@yahoogroups.comSubject=
: RE: [EVP-ITC] MiniBox - General Recommendations
 



I don't do any prote=
ction stuff, and no problems, but... I don't have my protectors on the othe=
r side, maybe others are not so fortunate.  Yeah, I had stuff banging on th=
e walls when I first started--very thrilling!! One slapped the closet door =
just as I fell asleep one night, that was a good joke from them, and taken =
as such! I did not stay up all night  checking the house, I didn't even get=
 out bed! Fear is useless.  Frank-S




To: evp-itc@yahoogroups.comFrom: pa=
ranormalinvestigating@...: Mon, 3 Dec 2007 10:31:59 -0500Subjec=
t: RE: [EVP-ITC] MiniBox - General Recommendations



Frank, That is very t=
rue there is an abundance of taps and most haunted influence on most new in=
vestigatorsand researchers coming into the field. A lot of the new research=
ers will have the luxury of starting and learning aboutevp using a box now =
that the RS is available. It's a shame because I believe those of us that p=
ut their time in the trenches when there where no boxes just cassette recor=
ders and then dvr's and you had to pray that the voices were loud enough an=
d clear enough to attempt to understand. I have been doing evp research for=
 a little under tenyears and have experimented with every type of method of=
 audio and visual itc and evp and only one time using a joe's box did Steve=
 and myself experience a peculiar and suspicious occurrence, when both our =
Joe's boxes where fried within 2 days of each other. other than that only t=
he occasional curse word or nasty response. If anyone that is attempting or=
 contemplatingdoing research with a box, if you are concerned about dark he=
ads just say a short protection prayer before each session and that will he=
lpto calm your fears. Bruce

Bruce Halliday Paranormal Investigating Team 
=




To: evp-itc@yahoogroups.comFrom: franks-boxes@...: Mon, 3 D=
ec 2007 08:00:17 -0700Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] MiniBox - General Recommendati=
ons



 I use my stuff with the Grandkids in the room, never--never--never-=
-has there been a problem. The disclaimer is no doubt one of those just inc=
ase things. All this stuff is brand new, the theory behind it scetchy at be=
st, and the infromation for site to will be inconsitent. It seems some expe=
ct it to be gospel truth, right off the bat. I'm still seeing alot of Holly=
wood at work here.   Frank-S



To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: lisby@eart=
hlink.netDate: Mon, 3 Dec 2007 05:00:19 -0500Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] MiniBox=
 - General Recommendations



Well, so much for the "Oh Noes!1!! What about=
s the childern!!??!1" misinformation. 



Ann






On Dec 3, 2007, at 3:19=
 AM, Lance Oliver wrote:




I pulled this list of general recommendations =
for The MiniBox right off Ron's www.paranormalsystems.com page -1. Do not a=
llow children under the age of 16 to use this device 2. Although individual=
 sessions are effective, group sessions are more productive.3. This is not =
an 'electronic Ouija board' - no harm can come from using it. 4. Some voice=
s will use coarse language so be prepared for it. 5. Always use a recorder =
to tape all sessions 6. Keep a notebook with the times and locations of you=
r sessions. 7. The MiniBox will call you by name so don't be startled by it=
. Lance
 
 
 



You keep typing, we keep giving. Download Messenger and jo=
in the i=92m Initiative now. Join in! 
 



Your smile counts. The more smi=
les you share, the more we donate. Join in!

giving. Download Messenger and join the i=92m Initiative now. Join in!
